update.description:
This PR updates the srckiosk and srcround components to be aware of updates to srcsimulation resources. Based on those updates the srcround component can update its UI status.

This can be reviewed
update.title: block srcround Run/Start/Stop buttons based on updates from Portal

content.raw: Ah I see. So the `_getSimData` call inside `attach` for `cs-srcround` is not accomplishing that? Maybe an alternative would be to add the same `_onTokenUpdated` logic to the rounds, and make the `_getSimData` call there... But we can keep it like this for now.
content.html: Ah I see. So the _getSimData call inside attach for cs-srcround is not accomplishing that? Maybe an alternative would be to add the same _onTokenUpdated logic to the rounds, and make the _getSimData call there... But we can keep it like this for now.

pull_request.title: block srcround Run/Start/Stop buttons based on updates from Portal

pullrequest.title: block srcround Run/Start/Stop buttons based on updates from Portal

content.raw:
This "undefined" case happens during page refresh . It is related to my comment from above in which we set (on purpose) `this.lastUpdatedSrcsimdataid = {}` in the srckiosc component, to force all rounds component to refresh their data.
Here, when `lastUpdatedSrcsimdataid is {}` or specifically `this.lastUpdatedSrcsimdataid.resource is undefined` we then fetch data from server
content.html: This "undefined" case happens during page refresh . It is related to my comment from above in which we set (on purpose) this.lastUpdatedSrcsimdataid = {} in the srckiosc component, to force all rounds component to refresh their data. Here, when lastUpdatedSrcsimdataid is {} or specifically this.lastUpdatedSrcsimdataid.resource is undefined we then fetch data from server

content.raw: note: this callback is only invoked when the servers notifies (via websocket) that there was an update in a resource. But , this callback will not be invoked when we do getAllRounds or getAllSimulators
content.html: note: this callback is only invoked when the servers notifies (via websocket) that there was an update in a resource. But , this callback will not be invoked when we do getAllRounds or getAllSimulators

content.raw:
This was needed when the login token changed. Eg.  when user refresh the page. 

By setting an empty object here, we are asking ALL srcrounds components to request fresh data from the server (each one will request the corresponding srcsimulations-xxx resource).
content.html:
This was needed when the login token changed. Eg. when user refresh the page.

By setting an empty object here, we are asking ALL srcrounds components to request fresh data from the server (each one will request the corresponding srcsimulations-xxx resource).

content.raw: thanks @chapulina ! Now that the related PR was merged to cloudsim-sim's default branch you should be able to use the src-0.1.17 (ami-c4a180a4) AMI for the simulator. For the FC I think you could use the dev one created by Ian (src-fc-0.1.12a // ami-8f2909ef) . The important thing to make sure is that the instances should do 'hg pull' from *default* branch to get the latest changes.
content.html: thanks @chapulina ! Now that the related PR was merged to cloudsim-sim's default branch you should be able to use the src-0.1.17 (ami-c4a180a4) AMI for the simulator. For the FC I think you could use the dev one created by Ian (src-fc-0.1.12a // ami-8f2909ef) . The important thing to make sure is that the instances should do 'hg pull' from default branch to get the latest changes.
